Hands-on Exercise 2

Beyond ggplot2 Fundamentals

1 Installing and Loading the required library

1.1 check the required packages: ggrepel, ggthemes, hrbrthemes, patchwork

pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, ggthemes,
               hrbrthemes, tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

2 Importing data

exam_data <- read.csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
reader is one of the tidyverse package

2.1 Beyond ggplot2 Annotation:ggrepel

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size = 0.5) +
  geom_label(aes(label = ID),
             hjust = 0.5,
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

orignal plot
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size = 0.5) +
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID),
             hjust = 0.5,
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
Warning: ggrepel: 318 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider
increasing max.overlaps

using ggrepel

3 Beyond ggplot2 Themes

3.1 Built_in themes

eight built_in themes: theme_gray(), theme_bw(), theme_classic(), theme_dark(), theme_light(), theme_linedraw(), theme_minimal(), and theme_void()

3.1.1 theme_gray

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_gray() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.2 theme_bw

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_bw() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.3 theme_classic

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_classic() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.4 theme_dark

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_dark() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.5 theme_light

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_light() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.6 theme_linedraw

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_linedraw() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.7 theme_minimal

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_minimal() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.1.8 theme_void

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_void() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

3.2 Working with ggtheme package

3.2.1 Economist theme

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_economist()

3.3 Working with hrbyhems package

3.3.1 hybrthmes (where lables are placed)

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum()

3.3.2 hybrthmes (add details)

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_title_size = 18,
              base_size = 15,
              grid = "Y")

4 Beyond Single Graph

4.1 p1

p1 <- ggplot(data = exam_data,
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 boundary = 100,
                 color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

4.2 p2

p2 <- ggplot(data = exam_data,
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100,
                 color = "grey25", fill = "grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

4.3 p3

p3 <- ggplot(data = exam_data,
             aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              size = .5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100), ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")

4.4 show

p1

p2

p3
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

5 Creating Composite Graphics: pathwork mehods

5.1 Combining two ggplot2 graphs

p1 + p2

5.2 Combining three ggplot2 graphs

(p1/p2)|p3
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

5.3 Creating a composite figure with tag

(p1/p2)|p3 +
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = "I")
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

Creating figure with insert

p3 + inset_element(p2,
                   left = 0.02,
                   bottom = 0.7,
                   right = 0.5,
                   top = 1)
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

Creating a compostie figure by using patchwork and ggtheme

patchwork <- (p1/p2)|p3 
patchwork & theme_economist()
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
